ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English fertil, from Old French fertil, from Latin fertilis ('bearing, fruitful'), derived from ferre ('to bear, carry').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of land or soil) capable of producing abundant crops or vegetation; productive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (指土地或土壤) 肥沃的；多产的；富饶的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The volcanic soil near the mountain is extremely fertile.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 山附近的火山土壤极其肥沃。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of a person, animal, or plant) capable of reproduction; having the ability to conceive or produce offspring.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (指人、动物或植物) 有生育能力的；能繁殖的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After several months of treatment, the patient was confirmed to be fertile.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 经过几个月的治疗，病人被确认为具有生育能力。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Producing many creative and innovative ideas; highly inventive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (指思想或想象力) 丰富的；富有创造性的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The writer’s fertile imagination allowed him to create entire new worlds.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位作家丰富的想象力使他能够创造出全新的世界。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of an egg or seed) fertilized and capable of developing into a new organism.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (指卵子或种子) 受精的；可孵化/萌芽的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Only a fertile seed can germinate and grow into a new plant.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 只有受精的种子才能发芽长成新的植物。
